definitions: Used to refer to the person or people that the speaker is addressing.
Used to refer to an unspecified person in general, often in contrast to 'I' or 'we'.
Used to refer to the person or people being addressed as the object of a verb or preposition.
Used to refer to the person or people being addressed as the indirect object of a verb.
examples: You never know what might happen.
I saw you at the shop.
